serverConfig.mustIncludeProtocol: Server URL must start with http:// or https://

admin.title: Admin Settings
admin.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this user?
admin.confirmMakeAdmin: Are you sure you want to make this user an admin?
admin.confirmRemoveAdmin: Are you sure you want to remove admin privileges from this user?
admin.configureExternalProvider: Configure external identity provider for OIDC/OAuth2 authentication.
admin.failedToFetchPasswordLoginStatus: Failed to fetch password login status
admin.deleteUser: Delete user {{username}}? This cannot be undone.
admin.confirmRevokeSession: Are you sure you want to revoke this session?
admin.confirmRevokeAllSessions: Are you sure you want to revoke all sessions for this user?
admin.linkOIDCDialogTitle: Link OIDC Account to Password Account
admin.linkOIDCDialogDescription: Link {{username}} (OIDC user) to an existing password account. This will enable dual authentication for the password account.
admin.linkOIDCWarningTitle: Warning: OIDC User Data Will Be Deleted
admin.linkOIDCActionDeleteUser: Delete the OIDC user account and all their data
admin.linkOIDCActionAddCapability: Add OIDC login capability to the target password account
admin.linkOIDCActionDualAuth: Allow the password account to login with both password and OIDC
admin.accountsLinkedSuccessfully: OIDC user {{oidcUsername}} has been linked to {{targetUsername}}
admin.unlinkOIDCDescription: Remove OIDC authentication from {{username}}? The user will only be able to login with username/password after this.
admin.masterKeyEncryptedWithDeviceFingerprint: Master key encrypted with environment fingerprint (KEK protection active)
admin.keyNotProtectedByDeviceBinding: Key not protected by environment binding (upgrade recommended)
admin.enableAes256EncryptionWithDeviceBinding: Enable AES-256 encryption with environment-bound master key protection. This creates enterprise-grade security for SSH keys, passwords, and authentication tokens.
admin.encryptExistingUnprotectedData: Encrypt existing unprotected data in your database. This process is safe and creates automatic backups.
admin.sshPrivateKeysEncryptedWithAes256: SSH private keys and passwords are encrypted with AES-256-GCM
admin.userAuthTokensProtected: User authentication tokens and 2FA secrets are protected
admin.masterKeysProtectedByDeviceFingerprint: Master encryption keys are protected by device fingerprint (KEK)
admin.keysBoundToServerInstance: Keys are bound to current server environment (migratable via environment variables)
admin.pbkdf2HkdfKeyDerivation: PBKDF2 + HKDF key derivation with 100K iterations
admin.backwardCompatibleMigration: All data remains backward compatible during migration
admin.masterKeysProtectedByDeviceBinding: Your master encryption keys are protected by environment fingerprinting. This uses server hostname, paths, and other environment info to generate protection keys. To migrate servers, set the DB_ENCRYPTION_KEY environment variable on the new server.
admin.keepEncryptionKeysSecure: Ensure data security: regularly backup your database files and server configuration. To migrate to a new server, set the DB_ENCRYPTION_KEY environment variable on the new environment, or maintain the same hostname and directory structure.
admin.testMigrationDescription: Verify that existing data can be safely migrated to encrypted format without actually modifying any data
admin.migrationInstructions: To migrate encrypted data to a new server: 1) Backup database files, 2) Set environment variable DB_ENCRYPTION_KEY="your-key" on new server, 3) Restore database files
admin.environmentProtectionDesc: Protects encryption keys based on server environment info (hostname, paths, etc.), migratable via environment variables
admin.verificationCompleted: Compatibility verification completed - no data was changed
admin.masterKeysNowProtectedByHardwareFingerpr: Master keys are now protected by real hardware fingerprinting instead of environment variables
admin.bothFieldAndFileEncryptionActive: Both field-level and file-level encryption are now active for maximum security
admin.fieldLevelAes256Encryption: Field-level AES-256 encryption for sensitive data
admin.fileLevelDatabaseEncryption: File-level database encryption with hardware binding
admin.exportDatabaseForHardwareMigration: Export database as SQLite file with decrypted data for migration to new hardware
admin.exportContainsDecryptedData: SQLite export contains decrypted data - keep secure!
admin.importDatabaseFromAnotherSystem: Import SQLite database from another system or hardware
admin.importWillReplaceExistingData: SQLite import will replace existing data - backup recommended!
admin.pleaseSelectImportFile: Please select a SQLite import file
admin.manageEncryptionAndBackups: Manage encryption keys, database security, and backup operations
admin.activeSecurityFeatures: Currently active security measures and protections
admin.backupAndRecovery: Secure backup creation and database recovery options
admin.crossSystemDataTransfer: Export and import databases across different systems
admin.exportDescription: Export SSH hosts and credentials as SQLite file
admin.importDescription: Import SQLite file with incremental merge (skips duplicates)
admin.cannotDisablePasswordLoginWithoutOIDC: Cannot disable password login without OIDC configured! You must configure OIDC authentication before disabling password login, or you will lose access to Termix.
admin.confirmDisablePasswordLogin: Are you sure you want to disable password login? Make sure OIDC is properly configured and working before proceeding, or you will lose access to your Termix instance.
admin.passwordLoginAndRegistrationDisabled: Password login and new account registration disabled successfully
admin.passwordLoginDisabledWarning: Password login is disabled. Ensure OIDC is properly configured or you will not be able to log in to Termix.
admin.oidcRequiredWarning: CRITICAL: Password login is disabled. If you reset or misconfigure OIDC, you will lose all access to Termix and brick your instance. Only proceed if you are absolutely certain.
admin.confirmDisableOIDCWarning: WARNING: You are about to disable OIDC while password login is also disabled. This will brick your Termix instance and you will lose all access. Are you absolutely sure you want to proceed?

hosts.title: Host Manager
hosts.noHostsMessage: You haven't added any SSH hosts yet. Click "Add Host" to get started.
hosts.importJsonDesc: Upload a JSON file to bulk import multiple SSH hosts (max 100).
hosts.exportCredentialWarning: Warning: Host "{{name}}" uses credential authentication. The exported file will not include the credential data and will need to be manually reconfigured after import. Do you want to continue?
hosts.exportSensitiveDataWarning: Warning: Host "{{name}}" contains sensitive authentication data (password/SSH key). The exported file will include this data in plaintext. Please keep the file secure and delete it after use. Do you want to continue?
hosts.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete "{{name}}" ?
hosts.failedToExportHost: Failed to export host. Please ensure you're logged in and have access to the host data.
hosts.jsonMustContainHosts: JSON must contain a "hosts" array or be an array of hosts
hosts.noHostsInJson: No hosts found in JSON file
hosts.name: Name
hosts.passwordRequired: Password is required when using password authentication
hosts.sshKeyRequired: SSH Private Key is required when using key authentication
hosts.keyTypeRequired: Key Type is required when using key authentication
hosts.mustSelectValidSshConfig: Must select a valid SSH configuration from the list
hosts.failedToSaveHost: Failed to save host. Please try again.
hosts.enableTerminalDesc: Enable/disable host visibility in Terminal tab
hosts.enableTunnelDesc: Enable/disable host visibility in Tunnel tab
hosts.enableFileManagerDesc: Enable/disable host visibility in File Manager tab
hosts.defaultPathDesc: Default directory when opening file manager for this host
hosts.sourcePortDesc: (Source refers to the Current Connection Details in the General tab)
hosts.tunnelForwardDescription: This tunnel will forward traffic from port {{sourcePort}} on the source machine (current connection details in general tab) to port {{endpointPort}} on the endpoint machine.
hosts.maxRetriesDescription: Maximum number of retry attempts for tunnel connection.
hosts.retryIntervalDescription: Time to wait between retry attempts.
hosts.autoStartDesc: Automatically start this tunnel when the container launches
hosts.sshpassRequiredDesc: For password authentication in tunnels, sshpass must be installed on the system.
hosts.debianUbuntuEquivalent: (Debian/Ubuntu) or the equivalent for your OS.
hosts.sshServerConfigDesc: For tunnel connections, the SSH server must be configured to allow port forwarding:
hosts.gatewayPortsYes: to bind remote ports to all interfaces
hosts.permitRootLoginYes: if using root user for tunneling
hosts.editSshConfig: Edit /etc/ssh/sshd_config and restart SSH: sudo systemctl restart sshd
hosts.credentialRequired: Credential is required when using credential authentication
hosts.credentialDescription: Selecting a credential will overwrite the current username and use the credential's authentication details.
hosts.enableServerStatsDesc: Enable/disable server statistics collection for this host
hosts.displayItemsDesc: Choose which metrics to display on the server stats page
hosts.customCommandsDesc: Define custom shutdown and reboot commands for this server
hosts.confirmRemoveFromFolder: Are you sure you want to remove "{{name}}" from folder "{{folder}}"? The host will be moved to "No Folder".
hosts.failedToRemoveFromFolder: Failed to remove host from folder
hosts.editFolderAppearanceDesc: Customize the color and icon for folder
hosts.confirmDeleteAllHostsInFolder: Are you sure you want to delete all {{count}} hosts in folder "{{folder}}"? This action cannot be undone.
hosts.failedToDeleteHostsInFolder: Failed to delete hosts in folder
hosts.failedToMoveToFolder: Failed to move host to folder
hosts.enabledWidgetsDesc: Select which statistics widgets to display for this host
hosts.monitoringConfigurationDesc: Configure how often server statistics and status are checked
hosts.statusCheckEnabledDesc: Check if the server is online or offline
hosts.statusCheckIntervalDesc: How often to check if host is online (5s - 1h)
hosts.metricsEnabledDesc: Collect CPU, RAM, disk, and other system statistics
hosts.metricsIntervalDesc: How often to collect server statistics (5s - 1h)
hosts.intervalValidation: Monitoring intervals must be between 5 seconds and 1 hour (3600 seconds)
hosts.monitoringDisabled: Server monitoring is disabled for this host
hosts.enableMonitoring: Enable monitoring in Host Manager → Statistics tab
hosts.terminalCustomizationNotice: Note: Terminal customizations only work on desktop (website and Electron app). Mobile apps and mobile website use system default terminal settings.
hosts.chooseColorTheme: Choose a color theme for the terminal
hosts.selectFontDesc: Select the font to use in the terminal
hosts.scrollbackBufferDesc: Number of lines to keep in scrollback history
hosts.bellStyleDesc: How to handle terminal bell (BEL character, \x07). Programs trigger this when completing tasks, encountering errors, or for notifications. "Sound" plays an audio beep, "Visual" flashes the screen briefly, "Both" does both, "None" disables bell alerts.
hosts.rightClickSelectsWordDesc: Right-clicking selects the word under cursor
hosts.fastScrollSensitivityDesc: Scroll speed multiplier when modifier is held
hosts.minimumContrastRatioDesc: Automatically adjust colors for better readability
hosts.sshAgentForwardingDesc: Forward SSH authentication agent to remote host
hosts.noneAuthDescription: This authentication method will use keyboard-interactive authentication when connecting to the SSH server.
hosts.noneAuthDetails: Keyboard-interactive authentication allows the server to prompt you for credentials during connection. This is useful for servers that require multi-factor authentication or if you do not want to save credentials locally.
hosts.forceKeyboardInteractiveDesc: Forces the use of keyboard-interactive authentication. This is often required for servers that use Two-Factor Authentication (TOTP/2FA).
hosts.overrideCredentialUsernameDesc: Use a different username than the one stored in the credential. This allows you to use the same credential with different usernames.
hosts.jumpHostsDescription: Jump hosts (also known as bastion hosts) allow you to connect to a target server through one or more intermediate servers. This is useful for accessing servers behind firewalls or in private networks.
hosts.jumpHostsOrder: Connections will be made in order: Jump Host 1 → Jump Host 2 → ... → Target Server
hosts.quickActionsDescription: Quick actions allow you to create custom buttons that execute SSH snippets on this server. These buttons will appear at the top of the Server Stats page for quick access.
hosts.quickActionsOrder: Quick action buttons will appear in the order listed above on the Server Stats page
hosts.sudoPasswordAutoFillDesc: Automatically offer to insert SSH password when sudo prompts for password

terminal.sudoPasswordPopupHint: Press Enter to insert, Esc to dismiss

auth.description: Secure, powerful, and intuitive SSH connection management
auth.scanQRCode: Scan this QR code with your authenticator app
auth.saveBackupCodes: Save these backup codes in a safe place
auth.twoFactorProtected: Your account is protected with two-factor authentication
auth.twoFactorActive: Two-factor authentication is currently active on your account
auth.disableTwoFactorWarning: Disabling two-factor authentication will make your account less secure
auth.generateNewBackupCodesText: Generate new backup codes if you've lost your existing ones
auth.sshNoKeyboardInteractiveDescription: The server does not support keyboard-interactive authentication. Please provide your password or SSH key.
auth.sshAuthFailedDescription: The provided credentials were incorrect. Please try again with valid credentials.

auth.sshProvideCredentialsDescription: Please provide your SSH credentials to connect to this server.

auth.sshKeyPasswordDescription: If your SSH key is encrypted, enter the passphrase here.
auth.step1ScanQR: Step 1: Scan the QR code with your authenticator app

auth.step2EnterCode: Step 2: Enter the 6-digit code from your authenticator app

auth.importantBackupCodesText: Save these backup codes in a secure location. You can use them to access your account if you lose your authenticator device.
auth.notEnabledText: Two-factor authentication adds an extra layer of security by requiring a code from your authenticator app when signing in.
auth.addExtraSecurityLayer: Add an extra layer of security to your account
auth.firstUserMessage: You are the first user and will be made an admin. You can view admin settings in the sidebar user dropdown. If you think this is a mistake, check the docker logs, or create a GitHub issue.
auth.loginWithExternalDesc: Login using your configured external identity provider
auth.externalNotSupportedInElectron: External authentication is not supported in the Electron app yet. Please use the web version for OIDC login.
auth.resetCodeDesc: Enter your username to receive a password reset code. The code will be logged in the docker container logs.

auth.loggingInToDesktopAppViaWeb: Logging in to the desktop app via web interface
auth.dataLossWarning: Resetting your password this way will delete all your saved SSH hosts, credentials, and other encrypted data. This action cannot be undone. Only use this if you have forgotten your password and are not logged in.
auth.authenticationDisabledDesc: All authentication methods are currently disabled. Please contact your administrator.

rbac.tempUserRecommended: We recommend enabling 'Create Temporary User' for better security.
